document_data.name: Yeshelmaar
document_data.caption: ''Yeshelmaar within the Forest of Lethyr''
document_data.mainbody: '''Yeshelmaar''' was a major settlement in the [[Forest of Lethyr]] and the center of civilization in the [[Great Dale]]. It was difficult to distinguish between the town's stonework and the surrounding hillside's volcanic stone. Plantings of trees and green ivy were featured throughout, while elevated walkways and stairways connected the town's spires.

Structure.The Spring Court: The Spring Court was held in a wide sublevel, with thin shafts leading to the surface; beams of morning light fell into the grotto from there. A pool of crystal water lay at the center of the chamber; with a great throne of pale stone in the middle; the [[Nentyarch]] sat there during meetings. The walls of the chamber had subtle designs of vines, leaves, and such; they appeared to move. The high druids had seats around the pool.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|118-119|13}}
Structure.Skymeadow: Skymeadow was a garden high on the side of Yeshelmaar. It had a patio of reddish flagstones, surrounded by low benches, themselves surrounded by leafy fruit trees. Outside that circumference, there were flowering mints and more fruit trees. Beyond, there was a landscaped pool with a cool grotto carved into the stone of the fortress. Within the grotto itself, there was a bronze statue of Corellon Larethian.{{cite book/Lady of Poison|131-132|14}}
